bestBHT.bht: The danger lies in the deceit of unrighteousness that lures people away from the love of THE truth. Rejecting THE truth and Jesus, who embodies the Truth, leads to their downfall. The one embodying this deceit is described as the son of perdition and cunningly employs trickery to mislead. While Satan's power is limited, those who perish do so because of their rejection and contempt of the truth. They become victims of the enemy through their lack of love for and belief in THE truth.

Henry Alford: and in all (manner of) deceit of unrighteousness
active deceit, of which the word is used
because they did not receive the love of the truth in order to their being saved.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: the victims of him whose very name describes his perishing nature, 'the son of perdition'; in contrast to you whom 'God hath from the beginning chosen to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth.'"
they are lost because they loved not, but rejected, the truth which would have saved them.
not merely love of truth, but love of THE truth (and of Jesus who is the Truth, in opposition to Satan's 'lie').
Albert Barnes: No one who has read Pascal’s Provincial Letters can ever doubt that this description is applicable to the system of the Jesuits.
The plausible reasoning by which the advocates of that system have palliated and apologized for sins of various kinds, has been among its most remarkable features.
They prefer this system of error and delusion to the simple and pure gospel, by which they might have been saved.
Marvin Vincent: Deceivableness of unrighteousness [απατη αδικιας] . Better deceit of unrighteousness; which is characteristic of unrighteousness and is employed by it.
John Calvin: He limits the power of Satan, as not being able to injure the elect of God...
Hence Paul, however he may wish them to be in a state of anxiety, that they may be on their guard, nevertheless, does, bid them cherish good hope, inasmuch as Satan’s power is bridled...
Paul declares that Antichrist will be the minister of God’s righteous vengeance against those who, being called to salvation, have rejected the gospel...
Philip Schaff: He will come and win acceptance not only by doing wonders which seem miraculous, but by every kind of deceit which unscrupulous wickedness can suggest.
Disinclination to learn the truth of course predisposes men to believe a lie, and gradually incapacitates them from discerning between the true and the false.
Unbelief tends to become superstition. The Jews who rejected the true Christ were led away by false Christs.
Archibald T. Robertson: This pastmaster of trickery will have at his command all the energy and skill of Satan to mislead and deceive. How many illustrations lie along the pathway of Christian history.
The love of the truth. That is the gospel in contrast with lying and deceit.
The truth if they had heeded it.
John Gill: He deceives, or goes about to deceive, or thinks to deceive by open unrighteousness; but by unrighteousness, under a pretence of righteousness and holiness.
There may be a flashy affection for the truths of the Gospel, where there is no true faith in Christ, or the root of the matter is not.
The reason therefore of these men's perishing is not the decree of God, nor even want of the means of grace, the revelation of the Gospel, but their rejection and contempt of it.
John Wesley: Because they received not the love of the truth — Therefore God suffered them to fall into that "strong delusion.

The one who embodies this deceit is described as the son of perdition and will use all manner of tricks and deception to mislead. However, it is important to note that Satan's power is limited and he cannot harm the elect of God. Ultimately, those who perish do so because of their rejection and contempt of the truth.
